title: RuPaul  Ho Ho Ho (1997)
description:
This is the campy holiday disc of the decade (if not the past 40 years) from 1997. Everybody&#039;s favorite sugar plum fairy delivers a batch of standards and salty originals as only RuPaul can. Some of these holiday covers are done so tongue-in-cheek (i.e., "I Saw Daddy Kissing Santa Claus") you expect to find an oral surgeon listed on the album credits. Still Ho Ho Ho (isn&#039;t that an allusion to an old Eddie Murphy line on Saturday Night Live?) really is fun fun fun, especially RuPaul&#039;s hilarious sendup of Eartha Kit&#039;s "Santa Baby," preceded by "All I Want for Christmas." Here the combined wish lists are slightly changed to reflect RuPaul&#039;s pronounced proclivities: cash, plastic surgery (a nice tummy tuck and some other anatomical manipulations, too), cash, and, of course, a big diamond rock. When it&#039;s all said and done, this is one Christmas sweet tart who wants "the total package, honey. TP." Ho doesn&#039;t come with one, but a PG rating here should suffice. --Martin Keller 

1. With Bells On
2. Rupaul the Red-Nosed Reindeer
3. All I Want for Christmas
4. Santa Baby
5. All Alone on Christmas
6. Christmas Train
7. Christmas Nite
8. Funky Christmas (Christmas at My House)
9. I Saw Daddy Kissing Santa Claus
10. Here Comes Santa Claus (Right Down Santa Claus Lane)
11. You&#039;re a Mean One, Mr. Grinch
12. Hard Candy Christmas
13. Celebrate
